## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r}
N <- 100 
n <- 80

storage_b0 <- rep(NA, N)
storage_b1 <- rep(NA, N)

for (i in 1:N){
  Xi <- rep(seq(-8, 2, length.out=n/2), each=2)
  Yi <- 1 - 2*Xi - (Xi^2) + rnorm(n, 0, 3)
  mylm <- lm(Yi ~ Xi + I(Xi^2))
  coef(mylm)
  storage_b0[i] <- coef(mylm)[1]
  storage_b1[i] <- coef(mylm)[2]
}

plot(Yi~Xi)
b <- coef(mylm)
curve(1-2*x-x**2, col = "black", add = TRUE)
curve(b[1]+b[2]*x + b[3]*x^2, col = "skyblue", add = TRUE)


```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r}
N <- 100 
n <- 80

storage_b0 <- rep(NA, N)
storage_b1 <- rep(NA, N)


for (i in 1:N){
  Xi <- rep(seq(-2.5, 2.2, length.out=n/2), each=2)
  X2 <- sample(c(0,1),n, replace = T)
  Yi <- -2.5 - 8*Xi + 1.6 * (Xi^2)*(X2) + 1.8*(Xi^3)*(X2) + rnorm(n, 0, 3)
  mylm <- lm(Yi ~ Xi + I(Xi^2) + I(Xi^3) + Xi:X2)
  coef(mylm)
  storage_b0[i] <- coef(mylm)[1]
  storage_b1[i] <- coef(mylm)[2]
}

plot(Yi~Xi)
b <- coef(mylm)
curve( -2.5 - 8*x + 1.6 * (x^2) + 1.8*(x^3), col = "black", add = TRUE)
curve(b[1]+b[2]*x + b[3]*x^2 + b[4]*x^3, col = "skyblue", add = TRUE)
```

```{r}
N <- 100 
n <- 80

storage_b0 <- rep(NA, N)
storage_b1 <- rep(NA, N)


for (i in 1:N){
  Xi <- rep(seq(30, 50, length.out=n/2), each=2)
  X2 <- sample(c(0,1),n, replace = T)
  Yi <- -500 + 20*Xi + 950 * (X2) - 22*(Xi)*(X2) + rnorm(n, -10, 10)
  mylm <- lm(Yi ~ Xi + X2 + Xi:X2)
  coef(mylm)
  storage_b0[i] <- coef(mylm)[1]
  storage_b1[i] <- coef(mylm)[2]
}

plot(Yi~Xi)
b <- coef(mylm)
curve(-500 + 20*x, col = "black", add = TRUE)
curve((-500 + 950) + (20-22)*x, col = "blue", add = TRUE)
curve(b[1]+b[2]*x, col = "skyblue", add = TRUE)
curve(b[1]+b[3]+(b[2]+b[4])*x, col = "skyblue", add = TRUE)
```
